title: The Chance to Double, Triple (or More) Your Profits From Oil’s Turmoil

title: Asia shares gain as BOJ eases further; U.S. crude slips
text: Asian shares bounced on Monday as the Bank of Japan (BOJ)  announced more stimulus steps to help cushion the economic impact of the coronavirus, while oil took another spill as the world ran short of space to store it all.

title: Oil falls as crude in US storage nears all-time high
text: Oil prices fell on Monday on signs that worldwide oil storage is filling rapidly, raising concerns that production cuts will not be fast enough to catch up with the collapse in demand from the coronavirus pandemic.

title: Investors bet on testing, treatments for restart of U.S. economy
text: Investors are pinning their hopes for the reopening of the U.S. economy on the potential for wider availability of testing for COVID-19 cases and on drug trials for treatments of the deadly disease but said, until there is concrete progress in these areas, further stock market gains may be limited.

title: Why oil prices went negative and why they can go negative again
text: If refineries ultimately don't want oil, it has little to no value. If you have oil and nowhere to put it, it can have negative value.

title: Economic damage from the coronavirus is hitting the lowest level of wage earners hardest
text: Lower-income groups, who depend on the service industry for jobs, are taking the biggest impact from the shutdown of an economy that is driven by service activity like hotels, bars and restaurants.

title: Op-ed: For Big Oil, this crisis will be different, and it may be irreversible
text: Oil and gas companies delayed in transitioning from fossil fuels and lost investors. The oil price crash caused by the coronavirus threatens to make this shift permanent.

title: Earnings Watch: Tech’s trillion-dollar valuations are about to be tested by coronavirus-tainted earnings
text: Only four U.S. companies have ever been valued at $1 trillion or more without adjusting for inflation, and all four will describe how their businesses have been weathering the COVID-19 pandemic in the coming week.

title: Why a flood of bad economic data isn't rattling stocks

title: 16% Unemployment This Summer: CBO’s Prediction And How To Prepare For It
text: On Friday, the Congressional Budget Office (CBO) updated its 2020 and 2021 projections for the U.S. economy. The CBO is forecasting that unemployment is likely to rise to 16% and then hold at levels of 10% through the end of 2021.

title: When oil became waste: a week of turmoil for crude, and more pain to come
text: The magnitude of how damaged the energy industry is came into full view on April 20 when the benchmark price of U.S. oil futures , which had never dropped below $10 a barrel in its nearly 40-year history, plunged to a previously unthinkable minus $38 a barrel.
